ingredient: 1 cup pancake mix, 1 egg, 1 tbsp oil, 3/4 cup milk, chocolate chips
instructions: mix ingredients and heat on pan

ingredient:
1 egg
1 teaspoon McCormick® All Natural Pure Vanilla Extract
1/2 teaspoon McCormick® Ground Cinnamon
1/4 cup milk
4 slices hearty sandwich bread

1 ⅔ cup / 200 g buckwheat flour (or other flour)
1 tsp. / 5 mL baking powder
1 tsp. / 5 mL baking soda
1 tsp. / 5 mL cinnamon
½ tsp. / 2.5 mL salt
½ cup milk / 120 mL milk of choice
1 large egg
½ cup / 120 mL maple syrup or honey
¼ cup / 60 mL avocado oil (or other oil for baking)
1 tsp. / 5 mL vanilla
½ cup chocolate chips
2 cups / 480 mL shredded zucchini (squeezed in a towel to remove extra
liquid)
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F / 175 degrees C. Prepare muffin tins by
greasing or using papers.
2. In a large bowl, mix flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon and salt.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together milk, egg, maple syrup, oil and vanilla.
4. Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients. Stir just enough to incorporate
the ingredients.
5. Stir zucchini and chocolate chips into the the batter.
6. Spoon batter into muffin tins.
7. Bake for approximately 16 minutes or until a toothpick or knife inserted
into the center comes out clean.
Heat oven to 425. Put nuggets on a baking sheet for 8 min, flip and do another 8 min

mealName: Roasted Chicken and Veggies with Rice
ingredient:
Chicken pieces (thighs shown)
Vegetables, cut into pieces (smaller/thinner pieces cook faster) Oil, for drizzling (I used avocado oil)
White rice (jasmine rice shown, cooked using 1:1.5 ratio of rice to water) Salt, pepper, or other herbs/spices for vegetables (optional) Other sauce or seasoning for chicken (optional)
Butter/olive oil (optional)
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F / 190 degrees C.
2. Put chicken in an oven-safe dish. Cover tightly with an oven-safe lid or with foil.
3. Put chopped veggies on a baking sheet. Drizzle with oil, salt, pepper, or any spices you are using for the chicken. Use your hands to make sure all veggies are coated with oil. Cover the baking sheet with foil, shiny side down toward the veggies.
4. Bake for approximately 25 minutes. See time saver note for alternate cooking methods.
5. Once chicken and veggies are in the oven, cook rice according to package directions.
6. Serve rice with butter or olive oil, if desired.
